ovdesc.p: Used to define the NETTING agreement that exists between the bank and customer.
Each agreement will be identified by its AGREEMENT.NO during the NETTING process.
A single agreement for each Customer record.
The first part of ID of the record can either be customer ID or 8 or 11 BIC code. BIC code accepted only for message type 101

desc.p: The currency for which the agreement is valid. If it is null, the agreement is for all currencies.
This field is inputable if the Netting Agreement Id has message type 102.
3 characters (uppercase alpha) - type SSS or 1 to 3 numeric characters Currency Code.
This can be either a customer code or customer mnemonic, followed by a "." & then the module or message type the Netting agreement is for (e.g. 100500.RP, 100500.102)
For each customer.module/Message type defined in the customer file an agreement can be established for the netting of transactions.

To define a Message netting for FT application (ie. to group MT103 / MT202's & send a single MT102 / MT203 in lieu of it) , the Netting.Payment field in DE.PARM & the Netting.Allowed field DE.MESSAGE should be set to "Yes"- Otherwise Not allowed.
1 to 6 Numeric character Customer Number or 3 to 10 character customer mnemonic + "." + Module or Message Type.
Module FT can not be given, instead message type(101,102,203) can be given

t.desc:
Specify the Customer BIC code for which there is an agreement to debit the account as mentioned in Inward MT101 message.
MT101 message requires Message User Group (MUG) registration and hence the registration is required between the Sender of the message and Ordering Customer with Receiver of MT101. To check this during Inward message processing, details can be specified here by creating a Agreement record for the Sender of MT101 (ID) and ordering Customer details (50G) in Agreed.Custs.
When Check.Agreement is set to "YES" in DE.MESSAGE for message MT101, then Incoming MT101 message will be moved to Repair incase the Agreement does not exist for the Sender or if Ordering Customer BIC code is not available in Agreed.Custs. This processing is applicable only when AGREED.ACCTS field is null and AGREED.CUSTS is not null for the MT101 message containing Ordering Customer BIC code processed through OFS.GLOBUS.MANAGER.
Validation Rules:
Input allowed only when the ID has message type 101 otherwise Not allowed.
Should be a Valid BIC code 8,9,12,11 Characters.

Specify the Account number for which there is an agreement to process the Inward MT101 message.
MT101 message requires Message User Group (MUG) registration and hence the registration is required between the Sender of the message and Ordering Customer with Receiver of MT101. To check this during Inward message processing, details can be specified here by creating a Agreement record for the Sender of MT101 (ID) and ordering Customer Account details in Agreed.Accts.
When Check.Agreement is set to "YES" in DE.MESSAGE for message MT101, then Incoming MT101 message with Account details will be moved to Repair incase the Agreement does not exist for the Sender or if Ordering Account is not available in Agreed.Accts. This processing is applicable only when AGREED.ACCTS field is not null for MT101 message containing Ordering Account details processed through OFS.GLOBUS.MANAGER.
Validation Rules:
Input allowed only when the ID has message type 101 otherwise Not allowed.
Should be a Valid Customer Account.

desc.p: The netting agreement number given by the customer.

Indicates the final date covered by this netting agreement.
Any contracts value after this date will NOT be eligible for netting under this agreement.
Any contracts from START.DATE to END.DATE will default to Y in the NETTING.STATUS field on the transaction.
Leaving this field blank indicates that the agreement is open ended.
Enter date in standard date format.
